title.narrative: CCM Sofala - Drought Response El Nino

description.narrative:
Target area: Sofala Province (Chemba District). Target number of beneficiaries: 4,500Households (22,500 individuals) Goal: To mitigate the negative impacts of drought impacting the lives of children and families in Mozambique through Food Security and Livelihoods, WASH and Nutrition interventions. Impact: To ensure children and their parents/children and their parents/careers in Sofala Province are able to meet basic needs to enable a healthy and dignified life at all times without engaging in negative coping mechanisms. Outcome: Affected households have adequate access to food and water and nutritional support to meet their daily essential needs, as well as access to market integrated livelihood activities which support their children#s wellbeing. For the II phase of the project,the project target 4,000 HH for livelihoods and WASH components. The project site continues to be Chemba District, Sofala Province.
Sector Objectives: WASH Sector - Affected communities have access to and use safe water and sanitation, and adopt improved hygienepractices, leading to reduced incidence of diarrhea and therefore risks of under/malnutrition. Output 1: Targeted households have sustained access to safe water in sufficient quantity (for their own consumption), and improved knowledge of hygiene and sanitation practices (For the II Phase the project seeks to improve the access to safe water in quality and quantity and promote hygiene activities for water/related diseases prevention).
FSL Sector - To enable crisis-affected households to cover their immediate needs and protect/restoretheirlivelihoods options without having to employ harmful coping strategies, especially those that pose an increased risk to women and children. Output 2: 4,500 vulnerable households in communities receive essential food baskets through market integratedsupport Output 3: 4,500 vulnerable households provided with livelihood inputs and support (For the FSL sector, 4,000 HH will be assisted through seeds distribution, training in Fall Army Worms, post/harvest technologies / Chemba District, Sofala Province)
Nutrition Sector - Establish / Provide screening and referral mechanisms to rapidly ensure treatment for severe and moderate acute malnutrition (SAM and MAM) andreduce the incidence of malnutrition in communities Output 4: More than 50% of SAM and MAM cases from the target communities are identified and referred to the respective nutritional rehabilitation services Output 5: District health services have increasedcapacity to plan for emergency nutrition responses Child Protection - Promote community awareness and engagement in the protection of marginalized populations including women and children. Output 6: Increased awareness and participation of field staffand community on key child protection issues.. (No specific tasks for nutrition)

The Christian Council of Mozambique is an ecumenical organization and humanitarian nature, founded by Protestant Churches and the Evangelical Missionary Association in 1948 with the purpose of developing the ecumenical movement within Protestantism as a result ofmore effective coordination of the work of different churches and the need to give voice to those who had no voice in the colonial period, during which the Protestant churches were marginalized, giving a greater privilege to Catholics, it has raised the CCM. At the level of the country, CCM brings together 24 churches and two Associations. This organization has a central office in Maputo and a representation in each of the ten provinces of Mozambique. The CCM has a long history of activism for peace and harmony among Mozambicans, particularly during and after the general peace agreement, signed in 1994, helping the most disadvantaged, and give voice to those who govern pay attention to your needs . Advocacy and lobby for social justice, etc..
The Christian Council of Mozambique -Sofala (CCM-S) The Christian Council of Mozambique - Sofala, is one of the ten provincial delegations that works in Sofala Province since 1988, bringing 16 churches and a Bible Society. Within the decentralization policy of the CCM, CCM-S, works on a semi - autonomous from the central office, can work in promoting ecumenism, unity among Christians and supporting sustainable community development, identification of projects and programs, implementation, administration and financial control. The work of leadership are carried out based on the selected staff from Churches in the foreground and procurement and posting at the place of execution of the Project.
Since the year 2000, the CCM-Sofala began a process ofchange in order to qualify for the new situation in the intervention communities and has established cooperative relationships with several organizations and funding, having been involved in key stages of the national response to HIV and AIDS, such as participation in technical advice for project assessment at the NAC in the design process of the minimum standards of care for OVC, with the MMAS, as well as, for example, experience of a range of design tools, with the support of CAP Mozambique, CCM adaptedthe manual Tips for Healthy Relationship and Choose adjusted Life and reinforced sessions Integrating Gender, HIV and Violence by Christian Council of Mozambique (CCM).
